page.title: 03EALAND
page.content: EALAND IS MOSTLY HOUSES WITH ABOUT 300 RESIDENTS. IT HAS A CHILDREN'S{ {PLAYGROUND}. THERE IS A SUNDAY SCHOOL, A CHAPEL AND A PUBLIC HALL. THE PUB IS CALLED THE NEW TRENT.THE RAILWAY STATION IS NEAR THE CANAL.AN OVERBRIDGE CROSSES BOTH.EALAND HAS A SPAR GROCERY SHOP, A POST OFFICE AND A SWEET SHOP.THERE IS A BRICK AND TILE WORKS, THREE FARMS AND A{RIDING}SCHOOL .{EALAND LAKE}IS VERY DEEP AND USED FOR SAILING, WINDSURFING AND WATER SKIING.IT WAS MADE WHEN THEY DUG OUT CLAY FOR THE M180.AFTERWARDS, IT FILLED UP WITH WATER.IT HAS BEEN SOLD .THE NEW OWNER IS HOPING TO OPEN A WATERSPORT CENTRE.LOCALLY NOT EVERYONE AGREES. THERE IS AN ANNUAL CHARITY{ {RAFT RACE}RUN BY THE LOCAL FIREMEN AND POLICEMEN.
